title: ‘Shoot to Kill’: Accounts of Brutal Crackdown Emerge From Iran
summary: The Iranian authorities have imposed an information blackout as they try to quell protests, but eyewitness testimony and videos conveying the deadly toll have made their way out.

title: Son of Deposed Shah of Iran Seeks Center Stage Amid Protests
summary: Reza Pahlavi, living in exile in the United States, has long marketed himself as a future leader of Iran. His father’s repressive legacy casts a long shadow.

title: Trump Explores Diplomacy With Iran While Weighing Strikes, Officials Say
summary: The Pentagon is presenting a wider range of strike options to the president than previously reported. Targets could include Iran’s nuclear program and ballistic missile sites.

title: A Crisis in Iran
summary: We take a look at the protests that have engulfed the streets of Iran.

title: Minnesota Sues to Stop Federal ‘Invasion,’ and Iranians Describe a ‘Blood Bath’
summary: Plus, the rise of at-home medical tests.

title: The Quest to ‘Make America Fertile Again’ Stalls Under Trump
summary: Administration officials have been urging Americans to get married and procreate, but some conservatives are frustrated by a lack of action.

title: Facing Political Pressure, Trump Seeks Answer to Rising Housing Costs
summary: White House officials have explored a vast array of ideas as the president looks to unfurl a housing affordability plan at an economic conference this month.

title: All the Things Named for Trump, and How Long Other Presidents Had to Wait
summary: In one highly self-referential year, he has broken with presidential norms on naming.

title: Labor Secretary’s Aides Placed on Leave in Misconduct Investigation
summary: The Labor Department is investigating a complaint alleging misconduct by Secretary Lori Chavez-DeRemer.

title: FBI’s ICE Shooting Inquiry Examines Renee Good’s Possible Ties to Activist Groups
summary: Former department officials warned that such a broad inquiry raised the specter that forms of political protests could be criminalized.

title: Trump Suggests Renee Good’s ‘Disrespectful’ Attitude Justified Fatal ICE Shooting
summary: President Trump suggested that Renee Good’s “highly disrespectful” attitude toward law enforcement played a role in her fatal shooting by an ICE agent.

title: Minnesota and Illinois Sue Trump Administration Over ICE Deployments
summary: The two Democratic-led states claimed in separate lawsuits that the immigration enforcement campaigns violated the Constitution.

title: ’Shrooms Lead the Pack in Psychedelic Medicine, but Rollout Is Bumpy
summary: Psilocybin-assisted therapy is legal in three states, but access has so far been limited and expensive.

title: U.S. Attacked Boat With Aircraft That Looked Like a Civilian Plane
summary: Even accepting the Trump administration’s claim that there is an armed conflict with suspected drug runners, the laws of war bar “perfidy.”

title: Trump’s Plans for Venezuelan Oil Run Headlong Into Reality
summary: President Trump’s fixation on Venezuela’s oil raises the question of how much “energy dominance” is really worth nowadays.

title: Venezuela’s Oil Riches Are Years Off, but Winners and Losers Will Emerge
summary: Companies that already have operations in the country stand to benefit, but those that have profited from a standoff between Caracas and Washington could lose out.

title: ‘We Need to Be the News’: Inside Bari Weiss’s Bumpy Revamp at CBS
summary: Her reimagining of “CBS Evening News” is under heavy scrutiny, and even became a punchline on her own network on Sunday at the Golden Globes.

title: U.S. Emissions Jumped in 2025 as Coal Power Rebounded
summary: The increase in planet-warming emissions came after two years of decline as demand for electricity has been surging.

title: Why China Is Suddenly Obsessed With American Poverty
summary: State media, embracing the gaming phrase “kill line,” is asserting China’s political superiority over the United States, deflecting focus on China’s own economic challenges.

title: What High School Seniors Wrote in Their College Admissions Essays
summary: Some students are still mentioning their race or immigrant status as the Trump administration cracks down on diversity efforts. But many are avoiding sensitive aspects of their identity.

title: At This Office Park, Scamming the World Was the Business
summary: Times journalists got a rare look inside one of the compounds where the online fraud industry makes its billions. Inspirational slogans (“Keep going”) were just the start.

title: Inside a Scam Complex’s Detailed Playbook
summary: The scammers at a vast office park in Myanmar wielded deepfake technology, doctored videos and pinpoint conversational ploys that differed by the ages and nationalities of their victims.

title: Gavin Newsom Vows to Stop Proposed Billionaire Tax in California
summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom said he was working behind the scenes to block a proposed tax on billionaires’ wealth and was committed to defeating the measure if it reached the ballot.

title: Richard Marx Is No Softy
summary: The singer and songwriter who struck it big in the MTV era has a new take on the Great American Songbook — and a lot of wickedly funny revelations about his life.

title: Trump Has Declared Premature Victory in Venezuela
summary: Allowing the remnants of Maduro’s regime to retain authority, even temporarily, is a potentially catastrophic mistake.

title: Can James Talarico Reclaim Christianity for the Left?
summary: Ezra Klein and State Representative James Talarico of Texas discuss his faith, his politics and his Senate race.

title: Meta Plans to Cut 10% to 15% of Employees in Reality Labs Business
summary: The layoffs are set to be announced this week and would affect Meta’s work on the metaverse, as the company spends heavily on building artificial intelligence.

title: The Sea Lions of the Galápagos Are Not Ready to Stop Nursing
summary: Animals that researchers call “supersucklers” come back for their mother’s milk even after they can hunt, mate and fend for themselves.

title: Elle Simone Scott, Chef and Cooking Show Stalwart, Dies at 49
summary: She was the first Black cast member on the PBS show “America’s Test Kitchen,” and used her influence to help other female chefs of color.

title: Synagogue Is Vandalized Days After Anniversary of L.A. Wildfire That Leveled It
summary: Graffiti denouncing Zionism was discovered Sunday on a wall of the campus, which has not yet been rebuilt after the Eaton fire.
